Answer - D (Sprint Retrospective)

The Sprint Retrospective is the most appropriate time for the Development Team to reflect on their practices and processes. If the Development Team identifies opportunities for improvement or finds that the current Definition of Done is inadequate, they can propose changes to it during the Sprint Retrospective. This allows the team to continuously enhance their Definition of Done, align it with their evolving understanding and requirements, and ensure it effectively reflects the expected quality and completeness of their work. It is a valuable opportunity to refine and update the Definition of Done for future Sprints.

Selected Answer: A
The Definition of Done (DoD) is created and maintained by the Scrum Team as a whole. This includes the Developers, Product Owner, and Scrum Master working together to ensure a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete.

Developers ensure that work meets quality standards.
Product Owner ensures it aligns with product goals and stakeholder expectations.
Scrum Master helps facilitate discussions about improving and applying the DoD.
If the organization has an existing DoD, the Scrum Team must follow it but can expand it to fit their specific needs.
